content.description:
Start with a couple of close bolts, moving right into a little chimney. Clip a 3rd bolt in the chimney with an extended draw, and back clean the first 2, otherwise the rope drag will be heinous. Use the awesome horn to move out right onto the face. There's an oddly placed bolt on the face that is too low to be useful - skip it, and clip the 2nd bolt on the face, then continue straight up past some more bolts.

I thought this climb had a bit of an adventurous feel to it and was worth a climb if you're here. You can use this route to get to the upper pitch of

Scenic Ride

.
content.protection: About 10 bolts.
content.location: On the left side of Live Action Wall, scramble up some 4th/low 5th Class to reach a comfy ledge where there are 5 bolted routes. "Welcome to West Germany" is the rightmost route on this ledge. It shares the first bolt with the route to its left.

content.description: Any takers for some slab climbing?
content.protection: 10 bolts to anchors.
content.location:
This is jJust left of

Live Action

.

content.description: This has fun climbing with good movement. It seemed easier than 11b to us on that day. The crux is in the first half of the pitch. This needs some more lichen removed, like all the routes here.
content.protection:
The guidebook lists 10 bolts (there are more!) to a two bolt anchor. It is closely bolted. Edit: looking at the guidebook, this route clips two more bolts to a higher anchor (past some serious lichen). Done this way, there are even more bolts, and the route is longer,

i.e.

does a 60m rope still work? 14 bolts?
content.location:
It is just right of

Son of Flubber

and left of

Team Umizoomi

. This looked like the 3rd bolt line from the left.

content.description: Easy climbing steepens to more sustained moves. A rest on the slanting ledge is found before the exposed/strenuous hand traverse right to the anchors around the arete. It was named for Jon Dory's son Ian who is one of the top Ninjas on TV (also not a bad climber).
content.protection: 12 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the main Live Action Wall. It is left of the large chimney and just right of Live Action, the namesake route of the area.

climbs.name: Team Umizoomi
climbs.fa: FA Greg Hand and Paul Heylinger 2016

content.description: Team Umizoomi has nice movement, but it still has some lichen. It stops at the first anchor you come to.
content.protection: The guidebook said 8 bolts. There are 11 protection bolts to a two bolt anchor. It is closely bolted.
content.location: It seemed to be 4th bolt line from left. It has an obvious "spike" of rock down low.

content.description: The crux is low, a few bolts up, after pulling onto the upper face. Thin and balancy face moves lead to much easier climbing. The crux is cool, but the route is not sustained. There are some very loose blocks just off the ground (avoidable).
content.protection: The guidebook lists 10 bolts, there are likely several more, which we found to be a theme on this wall. This route is closely bolted. It goes to the higher two bolt anchor.
content.location: On the left side of the crag, this is the 2nd obvious bolt line from left (although there is another line even farther left from these 2).

content.description:
From the intermediate anchor on

Lenten Passage

, take the flakes up and right out the left side of the

Scenic Ride

flake protecting with 9 bolts. The FA was by PH, GH.

Note: a block 15 feet up is stable but needs to go.
content.protection: 9 bolts to an anchor at the lip.
content.location:
Begin at the 1st anchor of

Lenten Passage

/

Hope You Like Pancakes

.

content.description:
Raggedy Ann is a little easier than its neighbor

Raggedy Andy

and not quite as good, but it is still worth doing. Going low on the route if you move left then back right it makes for an easier climb. Straight up the bolt line is more fun but a little harder.

This meets up with the route to the right (

Raggedy Andy

) at the last bolt and shares the same anchor.
content.protection: 6 bolts plus 2 for the anchor.
content.location: It is the 4th route from the right side of the cliff.

content.description:
This is the steep upper pitch above

The Absent-Minded Professor

and can be accessed by one of a couple routes below it. While the routes below it may not be all that great, this route is definitely worth climbing! Some varied technical face climbing leads to the steepest 5.11a climb I've seen in CCC. It is a good warm-up for the harder climbs on the wall. It is

140 feet from the anchor to the ground!

There are mid-anchors, so all you need is one standard length rope.
content.protection: 9 bolts to chains.
content.location:
This is the steep upper pitch above

The Absent-Minded Professor

on the left side of the wall. Look up, it's the steep roof.

content.description:
Raggedy Andy is a fun warm-up that stays consistently challenging on the first half of the route, requiring careful balancing using good sidepulls.

It meets up with

Raggedy Ann

at the last bolt and shares the same anchor.
content.protection: 6 bolts plus 2 for the anchor.
content.location: This is the 3rd bolted route from the right side of the cliff.

climbs.name: Night Into Day
climbs.fa: P. H. and Greg Hand, Feb. 2016

content.description:
Climb same easy slab as

Blazing Saddles

, then follow bolts on steep wall right of the crack.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
Begin with the same start as

Blazing Saddles

.

content.description:
This routes is the namesake route for the wall. It is very powerful and bouldery in middle of the route with a much easier start and finish.

There's an extension "Action Packed," 5.12b (FA: Kevin Capps, 2016) that adds 5 bolts to this climb and gets you 125 feet off the deck.
content.protection: 10 bolts to an anchor.
content.location:
It is in the middle of the wall between

Turtleman

and

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

.

content.description:
This improbable route weaves up corners and blocks to the final dihedral to the top of the wall. There is an intermediate anchor at the ledge 2/3 of the way up.

At the 7th bolt, climb to the left. DO NOT GO RIGHT to the loose rock.
content.protection:
Pitch 1: 70 feet, 10 bolts.

Pitch 2: 35 feet, 5 bolts.
content.location:
It is left of

Hope You Like Pancakes

.

content.description: The first 2 bolts take you to a ledge. Then follow 4 bolts on a slab near the arete.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: In the center of the Live Action area, a buttress juts out. This climb begins on the bottom of this buttress.

content.description:
The ominous pancake flake left of

Welcome to West Germany

is the first of 3 roofs on this steep line. This finishes at the anchors of

Lenten Passage

.

It was originally going to have a separate finish and anchor, but we deemed the anchor block unsafe.
content.protection:
10 bolts to

Lenten Passage's

anchor.
content.location:
It is left of

Welcome to West Germany

.

climbs.name: Explain Yourself
climbs.fa: P. H. and Greg Hand, Feb. 2016

content.description: Follow a bolt on a detached, large block to a bulge. Surmount the bulge, and explain yourself if it is easy. Momentarily marvel at the project up left. Move right around the arete, and climb up to an anchor.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
It is just right of

Night Into Day

.

content.description: The crux is right off the deck followed by some easier moves to a spicy finish. The guidebook gives it 5.11b, but it felt much harder to me.
content.protection: 5 bolts to an anchor.
content.location: This is on the right side of the wall. It is the second route in as you approach.

content.description: The most difficult part of the climb is near the start and the first three bolts. The rock here has a lot of lichen, and the holds are small. There is a small overhang between the 5th and 6th bolts. The overhang can be climbed directly or you can move to the left near a bush and basically skip the overhang. The climb seems like a mountaineering route as you pass easy sections, almost walkable, separated by steep rock climbing sections. The route gets you up quite high, and the view from the anchor is great.
content.protection: 13 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
The route is on the far left (west) side of the crag. You approach the climb by going up a 4th Class ramp/groove which leads to the start on a big grass and rock covered ledge.

You descend from the bolt anchor at the top.

content.description:
Climb an easy slab to a ledge. Clip 1 bolt on

Night Into Day

, and follow a steep crack on amazing incuts. A hands-off rest can be found on the namesake saddle.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
Begin uphill to the right of

Mr. Limpet

.

content.description: Climb over the low roof, a moderate middle roof, and the crux roof. Finish right of the prow.
content.protection: 14 bolts to the anchors.
content.location:
Start up the corner right of

Bolt You Be My Valentine

.

content.description:
This climbs the overhanging prow left of

The Incredible Mister Limpet

.
content.protection: 6 bolts to an anchor.

content.description: This was hard at the bottom and easy at the top. I had a tough time to even clip the 3rd bolt.
content.protection: 7 bolts + anchors.
content.location: This is the first route you pass at the right end of the wall.

climbs.name: The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle

content.description: This has lots of climbing at a consistent grade. About 2/3 of the way up a large flake was removed after the FA that makes a nice ledge. From there, move slightly right, and follow bolts up the layback to the anchors.
content.protection: 11 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
Begin about 20 feet right of

Team Umizoomi

. Boulder up unto a ledge, and traverse left to clip the first bolt.

content.description: With 2 "cruxy" sections separated by some enjoyable and engaging climbing, this is a nice route. Closely bolted, it starts with a steep section through/around some overhanging rock. Near the final bolt there is another tough bulge.
content.protection: The guidebook indicated 9 bolts. There were more, 11 or 12? It ends at the first anchors (on the left).
content.location:
It is on the far left side of the crag. There is another route to the left, but this one starts in an alcove of sorts, just left of

Son of Flubber

. Just follow the cliff to the leftmost line of bolts you spot. Climb 10 feet up a low angle slab/boulder to the first bolt. You can see several bolts through this steep section. It is the most roof-like feature here.
